measure.CatchLine: Requires city with population of 200,000 or fewer to establish local standards to promote housing stability no later than July 1, 2025.
measure.MeasureSummary:
Requires city with population of 200,000 or fewer to establish local standards to promote housing stability no later than July 1, 2025. Requires city to review local standards at least every 10 years. 
	Exempts from state preemption of rent control cities with populations of 200,000 or fewer that adopt local standards to promote housing stability and cities with populations greater than 200,000. 
	Declares emergency, effective on passage.
measure.RelatingToFull: Relating to local standards to promote housing stability; creating new provisions; amending ORS 91.225; and declaring an emergency.
measure.RelatingTo: Relating to local standards to promote housing stability; declaring an emergency.
measure.FiscalImpact: May have fiscal impact, but no statement yet issued
measure.RevenueImpact: May have revenue impact, but no statement yet issued

historyActions.ActionText: First reading. Referred to Speaker's desk.
